articles.author: Bradley Keoun
articles.title: First Mover: Tezos Led Crypto Market With Twice Bitcoin’s Gains in April
articles.description: Tezos is outstripping the usual crypto leaders on the outside track, possibly down to an increase in the number of exchanges offering staking as a service.
articles.content:
Bitcoin? Ether? Ripple? Meh. During a month where cryptocurrencies zoomed, the lesser-known Tezos beat them all. 
Tezos (XTZ), one of the largest and most prominent among a fast-growing roster of digital coins known as staking tokens, jumped 83% in April, th… [+3831 chars]

articles.title: Bitcoin (BTC) Price Rally: Supportive Higher Lows and 200-DMA Break
articles.description: Bitcoin‘s recent break higher is still supported by a series of technical indicators but the cryptos volatility and a large indecision candle warrant note.
articles.content:
Bitcoin (BTC) Price, News and Analysis:
  • Bitcoin spiked $1,200 on Wednesday as the 200-dma fell.
  • Overbought but supported by a series of higher lows.

articles.title: Bitcoin Rises Back to $8.8K Even as Futures on U.S. Stocks Drop
articles.description: While bitcoin is rising so far on Friday, the price rally looks overstretched and gains may be transient.
articles.content:
Bitcoin is up again Friday as losses are seen in U.S. stocks futures.
Following a rise of 23% over the last two days, though, the rally looks overstretched and the gains may be short-lived.

articles.author: Lisa Vaas
articles.title: Google fights spammy extensions with new Chrome Web Store policy
articles.description: The policies are specifically meant to fight spam, but they outlaw tactics taken by malicious extensions as well, including fake reviews.
articles.content:

For example, sometimes they stuff the store with multiple extensions that do the same thing. Like, s… [+4638 chars]

articles.title: Argo Blockchain Sees Revenues Soar 11x After Mining 1,300 Bitcoin in 2019
articles.description: Bitcoin mining firm Argo Blockchain said an 11-fold increase in revenues shows pivoting away from mining-as-a-service was a good move for the company.
articles.content:
